Package processor.utils

Class PatternValidationUtils

java.lang.Object
processor.utils.PatternValidationUtils
public class PatternValidationUtils extends Object
Utilities used in process of validating the use of design patterns.

  • Constructor Details

    • PatternValidationUtils

      public PatternValidationUtils(ProcessingEnvironment processingEnv, String patternName)
      Constructs an utilities class and initialize attributes used further.
      Parameters:
      processingEnv - environment used during processing annotations.
      patternName - name of the pattern, used in error reports.

  • Method Details

    • validateHasElement

      public final void validateHasElement(Element srcClass, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation)
      Checks whether source class contains any element that is annotated with a given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class in which the annotated element should be located.
      annotation - wanted annotation

    • validateHasStaticElement

      public final void validateHasStaticElement(Element srcClass, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation)
      Checks whether source class contains any static element that is annotated with a given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class in which the annotated element should be located.
      annotation - wanted annotation

    • validateHasPrivateElement

      public final void validateHasPrivateElement(Element srcClass, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation)
      Checks whether source class contains any private element that is annotated with a given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class in which the annotated element should be located.
      annotation - wanted annotation

    • validateIsInterfaceOrAbstractClass

      public final void validateIsInterfaceOrAbstractClass(Element srcClass)
      Checks whether source class is an interface or abstract class. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class that should be an interface or abstract class.

    • validateIsConcreteClass

      public final void validateIsConcreteClass(Element srcClass)
      Checks whether source class is a concrete class, which means not interface or abstract class. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      srcClass - the class that should be a concrete class.

    • validateSomeSuperclassHasAnnotation

      public final boolean validateSomeSuperclassHasAnnotation(Element classElement, Class<? extends Annotation> superclassAnnotation, Class<? extends Annotation> classAnnotation)
      Checks whether the class is a subclass of some class annotated with given annotation. Reports an error if no.
      Parameters:
      classElement - class that should be a subclass of some specific class.
      classAnnotation - type of annotation that implicates that class should be a subclass of some specific class.
      superclassAnnotation - type of wanted annotation superclass.
      Returns:
      true when some superclass has given annotation and false otherwise.

    • assertClassExists

      public void assertClassExists(Map<String,Set<String>> foundAnnotations, Class<? extends Annotation> annotationClass)
      Asserts that in the set of annotations there exists a given one.
      Parameters:
      foundAnnotations - set of annotations in the form of String.
      annotationClass - wanted annotation.

    • addToMap

      public Map<String,Set<String>> addToMap(Map<String,Set<String>> map, Element e, Class<? extends Annotation> annotation)
      Adds map entry based on class element and single annotation or if entry with such class already exists - update set that is its value with the new annotation.
      Parameters:
      map - map which needs to be updated
      e - class element
      annotation - annotation that should be added
      Returns:
      updated map
